questions.question_text: To which service does the Cloud NGFW for Azure send its logs?

discussion.content:
Answer D:
Azure Log Analytics Workspace
The Cloud NGFW can send traffic, threat, and decryption logs to an Azure Log Analytics Workspace that you will create in the Azure portal.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-ngfw/azure/cloud-ngfw-for-azure/logging/configure-logging-for-cloud-ngfw-on-azure#:~:text=The%20Cloud%20NGFW%20can%20send,create%20in%20the%20Azure%20portal.

Answer D:

The Cloud NGFW can send traffic, threat, and decryption logs to an Azure Log Analytics Workspace that you will create in the Azure portal.

Selected Answer: D
"D" is the correct answer. Panorama CLI and API, Terraform, and Ansible.

questions.question_text: Which automation tools should be used to create policies for Cloud NGFW for AWS?

choices.B: Panorama Console and Panorama API only
choices.C: Terraform, Panorama Console, and Panorama API
choices.D: Panorama API, Ansible, Terraform, and Panorama Console

discussion.content:
Version 11.1 and Later
In previous releases, ITO required that you deploy your VM-Series firewall in virtual wire mode. This limitation prevented deployments in Layer 3 mode supporting static or dynamic routing. This release removes that limitation by allowing you to deploy your VM-Series firewall with Intelligent Traffic Offload for L3 traffic supporting static and dynamic routing.

D. Vwire (Virtual Wire) mode

Virtual Wire mode allows the firewall to inspect traffic between two network segments without making any Layer 2 or Layer 3 modifications. This is ideal for implementing Intelligent Traffic Offload, where the firewall can offload specific traffic based on defined policies.

Selected Answer: D
Virtual wire mode "vwire" is the correct answer.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/vm-series/11-1/vm-series-deployment/set-up-the-vm-series-firewall-on-kvm/intelligent-traffic-offload

Answer is D:
Intelligent Traffic Offload is a VM-Series firewall Security subscription that, when configured with the NVIDIA BlueField-2 DPU, increases capacity throughput for the VM-Series firewall. The VM-Series firewall and the BlueField-2 DPU must be installed on an x86 physical host running Ubuntu 18.04, with kernel version 4.15.0-20. 

The VM-Series firewall must be deployed in virtual wire mode.

questions.question_text: Intelligent Traffic Offload (ITO) requires a firewall be deployed in which mode?

choices.D: NVGRE support for advanced VLAN integration
choices.C: Dynamic Address Groups to adapt Security policies dynamically
choices.A: Full set of APIs enabling programmatic control of policy and configuration
